00013   // create instance to make this Processor known to Marlin
00014   ConditionsDataWriter a_ConditionsDataWriter_instance;

00016   ConditionsDataWriter::ConditionsDataWriter() 
00017     : Processor("ConditionsDataWriter")
00018   {
00019     _description = "Collect the selected conditons data and write to the assigned CondDB folder." ;
00020 
00021 
00022     registerProcessorParameter( "DBInit" , 
00023                                 "Initialization string for conditions database"  ,
00024                                 _dbInit ,
00025                                 std::string("localhost:CaliceCondDB:user:password")) ;
00026 
00027     StringVec default_cond_collections ;
00028     default_cond_collections.push_back("CollectionName");
00029     default_cond_collections.push_back("/folder/name");
00030     default_cond_collections.push_back("HEAD");
00031     default_cond_collections.push_back("description");
00032     
00033     registerOptionalParameter( "ConditionsDataCollections" , 
00034                                "Define conditions data source (collection name) and destionation (CondDB folder, version and description) ",
00035                                _condDataCollections ,
00036                                default_cond_collections,
00037                                default_cond_collections.size() ) ;
00038 
00039   }
00040 
00041   void ConditionsDataWriter::init() {
00042     printParameters();
00043 
00044     if (_condDataCollections.size()%4!=0) {
00045       throw std::runtime_error("For each conditions data collection which should be written to the database\n4 strings are needed: collection name, folder name, version and description.");
00046     }
00047     
00048     for (UInt_t col_i=0; col_i+3<_condDataCollections.size(); col_i+=4) {
00049 
00050       _handler.push_back(new CALICE::ConditionsDataWriteHandler(_condDataCollections[col_i+0], 
00051                                                                 _dbInit, 
00052                                                                 _condDataCollections[col_i+1], 
00053                                                                 _condDataCollections[col_i+2], 
00054                                                                 _condDataCollections[col_i+3]));
00055     }
00056 
00057     _timeStampOfLastEvent=0;
00058 
00059     
00060 #ifdef DEBUG_CONDDB_WRITER
00061     _newRun=0;
00062     _nRuns=0;
00063 #endif
00064   }
00065 
00066   ConditionsDataWriter::~ConditionsDataWriter() {
00067     // delete all registered conditionsdata changed handler
00068     for (std::vector<CALICE::ConditionsDataWriteHandler *>::iterator handler_iter=_handler.begin();
00069          handler_iter!=_handler.end();
00070          handler_iter++) {
00071       delete *handler_iter;
00072     }
00073     _handler.clear();
00074 
00075   }
00076 
00077   void ConditionsDataWriter::processRunHeader( LCRunHeader* run) {
00078 #ifdef DEBUG_CONDDB_WRITER
00079     if(_nRuns>0) {
00080       std::cout << "ConditionsDataWriter::processRunHeader>Run " << _lastRunNumber << " : ";
00081       UTIL::LCTime first(_timeStampOfFirstEvent);
00082       UTIL::LCTime last(_timeStampOfLastEvent);
00083       std::cout << _nEventsPerRun << " event during " <<  first.getDateString() << " - " << last.getDateString() << std::endl
00084                 << std::endl;
00085     }
00086     _nRuns++;
00087     _lastRunNumber=run->getRunNumber();
00088     _nEventsPerRun=0;
00089     _newRun=true;
00090 #endif
00091     // --- debug
00092   }
00093 
00094   void ConditionsDataWriter::processEvent( LCEvent * evtP ) {
00095 #ifdef DEBUG_CONDDB_WRITER
00096     // --- debug
00097     if (_newRun ) {
00098       _firstEvent=evtP->getEventNumber();
00099       _timeStampOfFirstEvent=evtP->getTimeStamp();
00100     }
00101     _lastEvent=evtP->getEventNumber();
00102     _nEventsPerRun++;
00103     // --- debug
00104 #endif
00105     _timeStampOfLastEvent=evtP->getTimeStamp();
00106   }
00107 
00108 
00109   void ConditionsDataWriter::end() {
00110 
00111 #ifdef DEBUG_CONDDB_WRITER
00112     // --- debug
00113     if(_nRuns>0) {
00114       std::cout << "ConditionsDataWriter::processRunHeader>Run " << _lastRunNumber << " : ";
00115       UTIL::LCTime first(_timeStampOfFirstEvent);
00116       UTIL::LCTime last(_timeStampOfLastEvent);
00117       std::cout << _nEventsPerRun << " event during " <<  first.getDateString() << " - " << last.getDateString() << std::endl
00118                 << std::endl;
00119     }
00120     // --- debug
00121 #endif
00122 
00123     long64 last_record=_timeStampOfLastEvent;
00124 
00125     for (std::vector<CALICE::ConditionsDataWriteHandler *>::iterator handler_iter=_handler.begin();
00126          handler_iter!=_handler.end();
00127          handler_iter++) {
00128       
00129       //long64 temp=last_record;
00130       if (last_record<(*handler_iter)->currentValidTill() && (*handler_iter)->currentValidTill() != lccd::LCCDPlusInf) {
00131         last_record=(*handler_iter)->currentValidTill();
00132       }
00133       if (last_record<(*handler_iter)->currentValidSince() && (*handler_iter)->currentValidSince() != lccd::LCCDPlusInf) {
00134         last_record=(*handler_iter)->currentValidSince();
00135       }
00136     }
00137     if (last_record==_timeStampOfLastEvent) {
00138       std::cout << " ConditionsDataWriter::end> Conditionsdata for last event may be invalid, since time stamp of last event and last record are identical." 
00139                 << std::endl;
00140       last_record+=1LL;
00141     }
00142 
00143     // write the not yet written conditions data to the data base;
00144     for (std::vector<CALICE::ConditionsDataWriteHandler *>::iterator handler_iter=_handler.begin();
00145          handler_iter!=_handler.end();
00146          handler_iter++) {
00147       (*handler_iter)->writeConditionsData(last_record);
00148     };
00149 
00150     // output some statistics
00151     
00152     std::cout << "--- " << name() <<  " Report :" << std::endl;
00153     for (std::vector<CALICE::ConditionsDataWriteHandler *>::const_iterator handler_iter=_handler.begin();
00154          handler_iter!=_handler.end();
00155          handler_iter++) {
00156       std::cout << "\t" 
00157                 << std::setw(8) << (*handler_iter)->numberOfWrites() << " collections written after" 
00158                 << std::setw(8) << (*handler_iter)->changes() << " changes of "
00159                 << (*handler_iter)->name() << " : " 
00160                 << std::endl;
00161       UTIL::LCTime first((*handler_iter)->validAtMostSince());
00162       UTIL::LCTime last((*handler_iter)->validAtMostTill());
00163 
00164       //print validity interval only if data were really written to db 
00165       if((*handler_iter)->changes() > 0 )  std::cout << std::setw(8) << "" << "Validity interval:" <<  first.getDateString() << " - " << last.getDateString() << std::endl;
00166     }
00167     std::cout << std::endl;
00168     
00169 
00170   }
00171  
00172 }
00173 
00174 #endif
